title: arabspaceship123
author: arabspaceship123
created_time: June 17, 2022, 07:12:54 PMLast edit: October 03, 2023, 04:39:02 PM by arabspaceship123
content: altracoins.combtc-doubler.netbitcoindoubler.cash  bitdouble.gabitdouble.net cryptde.comdoubleyourbitcoin.orgdoublebitcoinfree.comdoublemybitcoin.orginstantdoubler.proDon't don't copy links they're criminal websites. If you make mistakes in believing them you'll get tempted for doubling.Don't do doubling you're responsible for losses it's scam. They don't have doubling algorithms they're lying.I didn't load screen shots they won't have nice photos free publicity they don't deserve it they're criminals.I’ve introduced cryptocurrencies to friends I’m telling them about modern financial opportunities. It's a new world. I’m happy they've asked on doubling Bitcoins websites. I don’t want new people in new financial world be scammed.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: These doubler scam websites have been run by scammers for a long time. Because they follow market trends to create these websites, and try to scam by attracting new crypto users. Since they want to scam by offering tempting offers, crypto users who try to make quick profits fall into the trap of such tempting offers. Thanks op, for finding these websites, because many new crypto users will stay away from this websites after seeing this post.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: Thank you for the warning arabspaceship123, but if you are going to make a list of all bitcoin doubler website it's going to be a very very long list.I think it's better and easier to assume that every website which promises a guaranteed high return is a scam and if you send them your money, you will never get it back again.Actually, I can't even understand how someone could fall for such scam!

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: If they've been run by scammers for long time their theft visitor ratio must be good imagine how many people send Bitcoin there. If they're not closed they're open for scamming I want people to understand they're 100% scam.Quote from: ScamViruS on June 17, 2022, 07:38:43 PMThese doubler scam websites have been run by scammers for a long time. Because they follow market trends to create these websites, and try to scam by attracting new crypto users. Since they want to scam by offering tempting offers, crypto users who try to make quick profits fall into the trap of such tempting offers. Thanks op, for finding these websites, because many new crypto users will stay away from this websites after seeing this post.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Recently the bitcoindoubler scammer switched to using a free subdomain site and g-form and it looks like an official offer from the provider. I'm not sure if reporting sites like this will be handled quickly due to the fact that they can create multiple duplicate pages at once without paying any fees.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: I've checked one of the sites and they offer to double your Bitcoin in 60 minutes or in one hour, there's no such as doubling your Bitcoin, its a scam right away even a bank cannot give you that kind of profit or even invest in the biggest company here in this world, so when you see the word double, better ignore or report it here for newbie's sake.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: arabspaceship123 on June 18, 2022, 07:21:24 AMIf they've been run by scammers for long time their theft visitor ratio must be good imagine how many people send Bitcoin there. If they're not closed they're open for scamming I want people to understand they're 100% scam.Let's put it this way, if you manage to close/block 1 such site, at least 2-3 new ones will appear. Bad guys use the freedom of the internet to do bad things, and no one seems to be able to stop them at this point. However, it is not just that such sites exist, but that someone can even think that such an offer can be true - a grown man who thinks logically should never fall into such a trap.Furthermore, people looking for ways to get rich quick are most often victims of such scams, and scammers are counting on that. Money does not fall from the sky, unknown people online do not share it with other strangers, but false promises are enough for some even when they suspect that something is wrong.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: arabspaceship123 on June 18, 2022, 07:21:24 AMIf they've been run by scammers for long time their theft visitor ratio must be good imagine how many people send Bitcoin there. If they're not closed they're open for scamming I want people to understand they're 100% scam.They are only using human greed to create such websites and scam them. You will find some people who come to the crypto world only with the thought of getting rich quick. Those who are looking for more shortcuts and ways to make quick profits are actually the victims of such scams. Those crypto users should try to understand that where they offer more lucrative offers, they are more likely to fall into the trap of scams.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: شكرا  I can't list every. If they're professional sites they'll confuse people. It's easy putting doubts in minds using websites that's how they fall for scams.Quote from: khaled0111 on June 17, 2022, 08:08:06 PMThank you for the warning arabspaceship123, but if you are going to make a list of all bitcoin doubler website it's going to be a very very long list.I think it's better and easier to assume that every website which promises a guaranteed high return is a scam and if you send them your money, you will never get it back again.Actually, I can't even understand how someone could fall for such scam!

comments.body: Quote from: khaled0111 on June 17, 2022, 08:08:06 PMThank you for the warning arabspaceship123, but if you are going to make a list of all bitcoin doubler website it's going to be a very very long list.I think it's better and easier to assume that every website which promises a guaranteed high return is a scam and if you send them your money, you will never get it back again.Actually, I can't even understand how someone could fall for such scam! I agree that even if they are supported by personalities or influencers or they boast of having connection to a well known company if they offer a very high percentage of daily profit or promise double your coin, it is a 100% scam, it can't ever be sustainable and no way it can be legit, scam is the other word for the doubler.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on June 19, 2022, 02:41:01 PMQuote from: khaled0111 on June 17, 2022, 08:08:06 PMThank you for the warning arabspaceship123, but if you are going to make a list of all bitcoin doubler website it's going to be a very very long list.I think it's better and easier to assume that every website which promises a guaranteed high return is a scam and if you send them your money, you will never get it back again.Actually, I can't even understand how someone could fall for such scam! I agree that even if they are supported by personalities or influencers or they boast of having connection to a well known company if they offer a very high percentage of daily profit or promise double your coin, it is a 100% scam, it can't ever be sustainable and no way it can be legit, scam is the other word for the doubler.Stating that it is endorsed by influencers and famous figures is just nonsense. This kind of scammer is even easier to guess, no need to do more research. No one really doubles money just by sending it instantaneously.send 0.1 BTC you Receiv 0.2 BTC, just a joke. in crypto anything can happen, there is no get-rich-quick scheme, everything requires a process.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on June 18, 2022, 09:59:21 AMRecently the bitcoindoubler scammer switched to using a free subdomain site and g-form and it looks like an official offer from the provider. I'm not sure if reporting sites like this will be handled quickly due to the fact that they can create multiple duplicate pages at once without paying any fees.It doesn't matter how many times we report they'll start more websites. They're buying domains and moving to duplicate sites frequently. Quote from: Saisher on June 18, 2022, 01:00:47 PMI've checked one of the sites and they offer to double your Bitcoin in 60 minutes or in one hour, there's no such as doubling your Bitcoin, its a scam right away even a bank cannot give you that kind of profit or even invest in the biggest company here in this world, so when you see the word double, better ignore or report it here for newbie's sake.Doubling sites are designed for confusing people so we can't blame inexperienced people if they don't ignore doubling websites. It's a heavy loss when they're scammed it's painful. All doubling websites are to blame they're criminals.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Even if they are not promoting Bitcoin any doubler be it on other coins or dollars is just a scam long before there is Bitcoin, there are already doublers and they are reported and treated as a scam, these doubler admins are trying to see if they can still victimize, like newbies in the world of investing, or a totally ignorant guy who knows nothing about investing.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: It's not just with Bitcoin. That kind of scam is very old. It's about them offering you a fabulous opportunity to make a lot of money, in this case doubling it, but you have to give/send the money first.In this case you have to send them your Bitcoins for them to "double" them and once you have sent them you lost them.Most of us don't get caught in these scams, but there is always the unwary who fall into the trap. I even remember that last year I was watching a video on Youtube of Saylor with some subtitles saying that to promote the Bitcoin, they also doubled what you had to send first. And it didn't occur to me to send anything, but at the time I didn't think it was a scam. I could have believed at times that it was a Michael Saylor promotion. It was the next day when I saw a thread about it on the forum that I realized it was a scam.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on June 30, 2022, 06:46:54 AMAnd it didn't occur to me to send anything, but at the time I didn't think it was a scam. I could have believed at times that it was a Michael Saylor promotion. It was the next day when I saw a thread about it on the forum that I realized it was a scam.There are a lot of fake videos I’ve seen in the last few months using Musk&Saylor in the lead roles, whether they’re subtitled or even dubbed, and for the inexperienced eye they can seem pretty convincing. In the digital world, there really are countless opportunities for scam, and scammers are taking advantage of it relentlessly.Instead of hours spent on YT or some social network, I would advise all these young people to read some good book, go to nature, or do some good deed. Because if you look for trouble there is no doubt that you will find it, sooner or later.

comments.author: Dgen-scam-hunter
comments.body: Thank you for the linksAll of those sites are now on our list.we will work on getting them all taken down.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Bitcoin doubling is a very popular scam, and anybody in crypto who don't already know that Bitcoin doubling services or offers are scam is indeed a newbie without sense of reasoning, impatient and severe greed are the two reasons why anybody will fall for this kind of scam because as i said earlier, this scam strategy is already very popular and outdated.When i newly got into crypto in 2016, this strategy was still very fresh then and a lot of crypto holders fell victim to this out of greed, a friend of mine in the UK lost over $100,000 dollars in the process of doubling his money to $200,000.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: Those sites are open fishing for victims they haven't been taken out. What's your list. What's the business you're doing. What's the work you'll do to get them taken down?Quote from: Dgen-scam-hunter on July 06, 2022, 03:52:39 AMThank you for the linksAll of those sites are now on our list.we will work on getting them all taken down.

comments.body: Quote from: arabspaceship123 on July 09, 2022, 07:24:01 PMThose sites are open fishing for victims they haven't been taken out. What's your list. What's the business you're doing. What's the work you'll do to get them taken down?By reporting these websites and taking down the websites, many crypto users can be saved from falling prey to scams. So it is important to expose such websites if you find them, as new crypto users are inexperienced about these scams so these phishing websites are very dangerous for them.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Quote from: ScamViruS on July 09, 2022, 08:28:26 PMQuote from: arabspaceship123 on July 09, 2022, 07:24:01 PMThose sites are open fishing for victims they haven't been taken out. What's your list. What's the business you're doing. What's the work you'll do to get them taken down?By reporting these websites and taking down the websites, many crypto users can be saved from falling prey to scams. So it is important to expose such websites if you find them, as new crypto users are inexperienced about these scams so these phishing websites are very dangerous for them.yes this can help but the problem is cultural. as long as there are users who think that money can be doubled without any kind of entrepreneurial effort or that bitcoin can be doubled out of thin air ... unfortunately such sites will continue to exist. it is the same mechanism that occurs with ponzi or hyip ...
